DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number or text term that describes the level of neuropathic pain experienced by an individual.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Intense painful sensation along a nerve or group of nerves. It is caused by irritation or trauma to a nerve or inflammation of a nerve._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Intense painful sensation along a nerve or group of nerves. It is caused by irritation or trauma to a nerve or inflammation of a nerve.

Concepts.definition: Intense painful sensation along a nerve or group of nerves. It is caused by irritation or trauma to a nerve or inflammation of a nerve.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for DCRI Pharmacovigilance study per request by T.Locklear. mc 8/1/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.: A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is usually transient, and requires no special treatment or intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual daily activities. Includes transient laboratory test alterations.
A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.: A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

Concepts.definition: An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.
A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.: A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.
A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Follow up assessment question
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the neuropathic pain worsened, what is the current level of neuropathic pain?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Select one- grade according to NCI Criteria version 4.03.
